title: Apple's Design-Led Strategy: How Aesthetics Beat Specs
description: A quick, practical guide to Apple's Design-Led Strategy: How Aesthetics Beat Specs.

hook.text: The original iMac (1998) was technically inferior to competitors. It came in translucent candy colors.

discovery.text: Jony Ive's design team had veto power over engineering. If a component made the product ugly, engineering found a new way.

twist.text: This inverted the normal tech hierarchy (engineer first, designer second).

climax.text: Apple became the first $3 trillion company. Its premium pricing is sustained by design â€” people pay more for products.

punchline.text: Apple proved that design isn't a cost. It's the product.
